description:
​Seventeen years ago, Takafumi's uncle fell into a coma, but now he's back like a man risen from his grave. Soon, Takafumi discovers two bizarre things: His uncle treasures video games above all else, and, while comatose, he was actually transported to another world as some heroic guardian! Now, not only does Takafumi have to room with an uncle who is literally magical, he also has to catch the guy up on two decades of history—smartphones, high-speed internet, modern anime tropes…and the traumatic outcome of the '90s console war!

(Source: Yen Press)
synonyms: ยอดคุณน้าจากต่างโลก
Mi tío es de otro mundo
Coma héroïque dans un autre monde

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: POV
tags.description: Point of View; features scenes shown from the perspective of the series protagonist.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Feet
tags.description: Features the sexual depiction or stimulation of a character's feet.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大田和寛)

Freelancer with former ties with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/) and [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).

__Height:__ 157 cm
__Agency:__ Office Osawa

[Website](http://whv-amusic.com/iguchiyuka/index.html) | [Profile](http://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/iguchiyuka/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yukachiofficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ooo31_iguchiyuka_31ooo/) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/15320.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuka_Iguchi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BA%95%E5%8F%A3%E8%A3%95%E9%A6%99) | [Youtube](https://youtube.com/@officialyoutubechannel3974?si=9AjlJ6Ujj2Vw1CiU)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Liter - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Otaru Rio - Nogizaka Haruka no Himitsu: Cosplay, Hajimemashita (VN)
- 37 - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Koleda Belobog - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

**[Website](https://mayumaeshima.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_0414mayu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_0414mayu/)**

Japanese singer. She was the lead vocalist of the music unit [MYTH & ROID](https://anilist.co/staff/119976) from 2015 to 2017. She made her major debut as a solo artist in 2019. Her first solo single "Long shot" was released on February 24, 2021 under KADOKAWA, and was used as the second opening theme to the second season of the anime series [Re:Zero − Starting Life in Another World](https://anilist.co/anime/119661).

She started off as a painter in the early '80s, and then switched to photography work. Stopped doing photography when animation switched to digital and nowadays just focuses on special effects.

Titular member of Team Taniguchi, a subsidiary of [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) specializing in special effects.
